review_title: I love the people that work here.  There is no perfect Company or Job!

pros: I love the people I work with and the patients.  Every job has its draw backs and its all about an individuals perception!  You can make it a great place to spend your working hours.
cons: Small, Very busy and can be hectic!

job_title: Business Development in San Antonio, TX
pros: Absolutely none! You only get one star because I can not enter zero
cons:
Lack of structure. There is no organization in this company. There is no Bonus compensation.  

Everyone in the system does Buisness development making it impossible to create a sound Buisness plan. 

Expenses take a ridiculous amount of time to approve. They blame it on concur, but it's not the software... The hold up is getting administration to approve expenses. They rather you front expenses on your own and then get reimbursed. A check request is a very challenging process. 

Senior administration has been replaced because of the barriers they were causing... Except the new administration created all new barriers. They say they have an open door policy, but if you say or inquire about something that is against their agenda, they will be little you.  Have a thick skin working here, they cuss a lot! I hope you don't have a problem with the FBomb, AHole or B words... They use them a lot and say if you are offended go else where.  Very hostile environment. 

Most of the physicians they want you to work with will be upset with hospital and are wanting to leave this health system. 

There is absolutely no belief in the value of they system. 

Apply else where!

job_title: Nutrition Technician in San Antonio, TX
pros:
Free employee meals
Good entry level position
Free downtown parking (during work hours)
Benefits and 3 weeks paid vacation per year (full-time only)
cons:
Management expects employees to work double shifts without notice.
Schedules change on a day to day bases. Sometimes without notification.
Management has never worked in the foodservice industry, but yet is managing a kitchen. 
Raises were frozen during my employment - no raise (during 2 year period)
Employees should receive a 90 day review (after first 90 days) and an annual review. However, management doesn't perform reviews, unless they are trying to terminate an employee. 
Management plays the "favorite".game.
Limited advancement opportunities within department. 
Open on Holidays. No overtime or any form of compensation.
Corporate will cut full-time employee hours. You can use vacation hours (if you have them) to make up lost hours. 
No new technology, everything is completed by hand....lot's of writing. 
Limited training
No cell phone use

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: Close to my home. Short drive.
cons: No one work here. Especially doing this job. The two "managers" are horrible. They expect you to answer calls, do assessments for walk-ins, do assessments @ vance jackson, and take report on patients coming or  going from different hospitals. And if you don't do it all, you can see the door. It is impossible and they don't care !!!! These people are horrible, including all MAT assessors. The assessors are so stuck up and if you ask then a questions, they look at you like you are stupid. I would not recommend my worst enemy to work here!!!! Terrible group of people.

job_title: LVN in San Antonio, TX
pros: I love working 12 hr shifts, three PM's in a row and having 4 days off.  There is over time available if you are interested in working more hours.
cons: There aren't any incentives to stay with the company.  I've been there one yr, on time, work extra, never called in, gone to all sites when needed. I was told they don't give raises. No holiday pay. I feel the pt care could improve.

review_title: Don't work here!!!  Runs on "favorites" system!!
job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: The only thing I liked about working here was that it is on the beautiful riverwalk. Aside from this, there is nothing great about working here.
cons: Plenty. No support from upper management or immediate supervisors. If you have a difference of opinion or are not in a clique, they will find ways to weed you out. Some nurses are great, but most of them are not so pleasant, but these are the nurses that know they are untouchable because they are part of the clique.

review_title: A Good, Yet small in-house security dept.

pros: Outstanding benefits, Overtime is possible, squeezing up towards $13 bucks with 3rd shift differential pay
cons: Pulling nite-time ER duty provides a sad experience, and the Psych ward population of 2 separate clinics is another, You need a strong will to succeed,

pros: There are no Pros to working for The Nix hospital.  Again, there are no Pros to working for The Nix hospital, except that San Antonio is a great place.
cons: The Nix is a stupid organization that has a turnover rate in the 30's or higher.  Employess are treated like meat and patient care is all but non existent in search of profits for the venture capitalists and the California mafia.

pros: The nurses working at the nix behavioral health system are very helpful and friendly. I miss them the most.
cons: The Behavioral health program does not have the proper structure to maximize therapeutic experience for the patients and some of the doctors do not show respect to the nurses.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in San Antonio, TX
